p: Concisely, we have documented for the first time traditional knowledge of medicinal plants integrated into the traditional system of medicine for the treatment of cancer in Sokoto state. In the present study, a total of 67 species of medicinal plants belonging to 31 families have been documented. Out of which, A. nilotica recorded the highest use-reports, followed by G. senegalensis, and subsequently E. sigmoidea. Additionally, various forms of diagnosis, the plant parts used, their modes of preparation, and different routes of administration have also been documented. The present study provides a baseline for future pharmacological investigations into the beneficial effects of local medicinal plants for the treatment of cancer.
